intro: Baltimora alata, commonly known as the winged bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, winged stems and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Baltimora alata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
